Bonds Of Executors, Administrators, Guardians, Conservators, Trustees And Receivers

law.text: Sureties on probate bonds shall be inhabitants of the commonwealth, and satisfactory to the judge or register; except that companies permitted by section one hundred and five of chapter one hundred and seventy-five to act as sureties may be accepted in accordance with the provisions thereof and that, if the property of a person under guardianship or conservatorship is composed in whole or in part of any benefit, estate or income paid or payable by or through the United States veteransâ€™ bureau or its successor and exceeds five hundred dollars, the surety on the bond of the guardian or conservator shall be such a company.
